meanings.definition: The quality or state of being inhospitable.
meanings.sent1: The inhospitablenesses of the desert made it difficult for travelers to find shelter.
meanings.sent2: The inhospitablenesses of the hotel staff left the guests feeling unwelcome.
meanings.sent3: The inhospitablenesses of the grumpy cat were evident as it refused to let anyone pet it.
meanings.sent4: The inhospitablenesses of the storm clouds warned of an impending downpour.
meanings.sent5: The inhospitablenesses of the icy wind chilled the bones of the hikers.

meanings.definition: Lack of warmth or friendliness; unwelcoming nature.
meanings.sent1: The inhospitablenesses of the teacher made the students hesitant to ask questions.
meanings.sent2: The inhospitablenesses of the receptionist made visitors feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The inhospitablenesses of the grumpy old man melted away when he saw the puppies.
meanings.sent4: The inhospitablenesses of the situation made it hard for trust to grow between them.
meanings.sent5: The inhospitablenesses of the dark alley sent shivers down her spine.
